text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak says there is no new reason to convene another Arab summit now.
Mubarak also stressed that Egypt welcomed foreign investment be it in the form of independent projects or those set up in partnership with the Egyptian private sector.
- Mubarak speaks by telephone with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and then with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat on the latest developments in the peace process.
- Chirac asks Israel to accept an independent Palestinian state, return the Golan Heights to Syria, and withdraw from southern Lebanon.
- President Mubarak says that there must be a European role in the peace process.

- Security authorities catch 34 "terrorists" in Beni Suef and Minya provinces; the group organised and carried out killings in the area and attacked a branch of Bank Misr. One security official was killed and three people wounded.
- President Mubarak says the economic summit will be held in November and that Israel will pay the price if it does not advance peace.
- Mubarak holds talks with the Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi and Foreign Minister Amr Moussa meets with French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette for talks on the peace process.
